TEXT: The applicants , whose names appear in the appendix , are siblings . They are NORP nationals . The respondent Government were represented by Mr P. Kresák , their Agent .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .

On DATE the applicants lodged an action for restitution of property under LAW of DATE with the Bratislava - vidiek ORG súd ) . They relied on Sections CARDINAL § CARDINAL and CARDINAL § CARDINAL of this LAW and claimed that real property which formed a part of their late GPE estate and which was in the possession of CARDINAL individuals should be restored to them .
On DATE the ORG delivered a copy of the action to the defendants .
On DATE the applicants authorised an advocate to represent them in the proceedings .

On DATE the applicants filed a motion to ORG to secure evidence by hearing CARDINAL witnesses . They drew the court ’s attention to the fact that the CARDINAL witnesses were aged and in a poor state of health which did not permit them to appear in court . At the same time , they informed the court of the appointment of their lawyer and submitted additional documentary evidence .
On DATE the defendants requested an extension of the timelimit for filing their observations in reply to the action .
On DATE the defendants authorised a lawyer to represent them in the proceedings and , on CARDINAL DATE , they submitted their observations .
By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the defendants requested that a hearing scheduled for DATE be adjourned as their lawyer was unable to attend on that date .
On DATE the applicants’ lawyer requested that a hearing scheduled for DATE be adjourned at least until DATE due to health problems of CARDINAL of the applicants .

In consequence of a certificate issued by a doctor on DATE , the participation of CARDINAL of the defendants in the lawsuit was judged inappropriate as it could bring about deterioration in her health .

On CARDINAL DATE ORG held a hearing . CARDINAL applicants and CARDINAL defendant were not present . Their lawyers however excused their absence and took part in the hearing . The GPE lawyer proposed that , having regard to the medical condition of his absent client , it might be appropriate to hear her at her home .
On DATE CARDINAL of the applicants requested that ORG hear CARDINAL witnesses . She pointed out that CARDINAL of the witnesses were aged and were in poor health .
On DATE ORG held the second hearing . CARDINAL applicant and CARDINAL defendant were not present but they excused their absence through their lawyers who took part in the hearing .
On DATE ORG held the third hearing . CARDINAL applicants were not present but their lawyer , who was present , apologised for their absence .
At an unspecified time the legal representative of the applicants requested that ORG hear no witnesses before DATE .
On DATE the legal representative of the defendants requested that ORG hear witnesses only after DATE .

ORG , acting through another judge ( the second judge ) , had to adjourn the hearing scheduled for DATE as none of the invited witnesses appeared , CARDINAL of them having died in the meantime and CARDINAL being seriously ill .
On DATE and on DATE the applicants amended their action and submitted supplementary evidence in support of it .
On DATE the defendants submitted their observations in reply to the amended action .
On DATE the applicants complained about delays in the proceedings to the President of ORG . On DATE they sent a similar complaint to the Minister of ORG .

On DATE the President of ORG informed the applicants that the judge dealing with the case had a heavy workload and that there was a shortage of judges at that court . He further informed them that the progress of case would be under supervision in order to avoid further delays .

In DATE and DATE the applicants requested that ORG promptly hear PERSON , another witness . They pointed out that PERSON was elderly and in a poor state of health which prevented him from appearing in court . On DATE a trainee judge ( právna čakateľka ) of the ORG heard S. at his home . The witness maintained that he could only take part in a court hearing after the completion of medical treatment that was to commence on DATE . No party to the proceedings took part in that hearing . On DATE ORG sent a copy of the record of the hearing to the parties .
On DATE the defendants challenged the truthfulness of the testimony of S. and requested that he be reheard in a courtroom .
At DATE , the case was assigned to another judge ( the third judge ) in accordance with the general DATE reallocation of cases for the judicial DATE .
On DATE ORG held the fourth hearing . CARDINAL applicants and CARDINAL defendant did not appear . Their representatives took part in the hearing and excused them .

On DATE the applicants requested that ORG hear several witnesses . They drew the court ’s attention to the fact that the witnesses were aged and that several witnesses whom they had previously proposed to hear had died .
On DATE ORG held the fifth hearing .
On DATE the applicants requested that ORG hear CARDINAL of the defendants .

On DATE ORG scheduled that defendant ’s hearing for DATE . However , the hearing could not take place and had to be postponed as , by that time , the postal service had not provided a report showing that the invitations had been served on the parties in time . The hearing took place at the defendant ’s home on DATE .
On DATE CARDINAL of the applicants requested ORG not to schedule a hearing before DATE as she would be on a business trip until DATE .
The hearing called for DATE was adjourned and ORG ordered the applicants to submit further documentary evidence . The applicants complied on DATE .
On DATE a ORG Judge heard another witness .
In a submission of CARDINAL DATE the applicants restated their action in that they sought a judicial ruling declaring them to be the owners of the property in question .
On DATE the defendants submitted their observations in reply to the restated action .

At the sixth hearing held before FAC on DATE , the applicants , through their lawyer , confirmed that they wished to modify the original subjectmatter of their action . They undertook to submit a newly reformulated version of their action within DATE .

On DATE the applicants submitted the amended action in which they sought a judicial ruling declaring void a donation agreement and ordering the defendants to restore the real property in issue to them .
On DATE the defendants filed their observations in reply to the redrafted action .
At the seventh hearing held on DATE ORG decided not to grant the applicants leave to change the subjectmatter of their action .
On DATE the applicants filed their final submission .

On DATE , following the eighth hearing , ORG dismissed the action . It found , inter alia , that the applicants had failed to prove that their legal predecessors had formally owned the property in question . It further found that it had not been established that the ORG had taken over the property and that the defendants had acquired the property from the ORG contrary to the rules then in force which were the prerequisites for granting the claim . The decision was served on the legal representatives of the parties on DATE .

On DATE the applicants appealed . They argued inter alia that their title to the property was based on hereditary succession and that , in the past , the ORG has actually prevented them from using the property at issue .
On DATE the defendants filed their comments on the appeal .

On DATE , following a hearing , ORG upheld the first instance judgment . It found that the evidence available indicated that the property in question had never been formally transferred to the ORG . The fact that the ORG had actually disposed of the property had no bearing on this conclusion . The defendants had acquired the property by succession and by donation inter vivos within their family . ORG therefore concluded that the requirements for the restitution of the property were not met .

On DATE the applicants filed an appeal on points of law to ORG . The latter declared it inadmissible on DATE having found no shortcomings in the proceedings which would justify quashing ORG judgment .
